akn:section.akn:heading: Fraud and related activity in connection with obtaining confidential phone records information of a

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Whoever, in interstate or foreign commerce, knowingly and intentionally obtains, or attempts to obtain, confidential phone records information of a covered entity, by— shall be fined under this title, imprisoned for not more than 10 years, or both.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Prohibition on Sale or Transfer of Confidential Phone Records Information.—
Prohibition on Purchase or Receipt of Confidential Phone Records Information.—

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Whoever violates, or attempts to violate, subsection (a), (b), or (c) while violating another law of the United States or as part of a pattern of any illegal activity involving more than $100,000, or more than 50 customers of a covered entity, in a 12-month period shall, in addition to the penalties provided for in such subsection, be fined twice the amount provided in subsection (b)(3) or (c)(3) (as the case may be) of section 3571 of this title, imprisoned for not more than 5 years, or both.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Enhanced Penalties for Use of Information in Furtherance of Certain Criminal Offenses.—

akn:content.akn:p: (f) There is extraterritorial jurisdiction over an offense under this section.

(g) This section does not prohibit any lawfully authorized investigative, protective, or intelligence activity of a law enforcement agency of the United States, a State, or political subdivision of a State, or of an intelligence agency of the United States.
